benchmark_details.name: BuDDIE (Business Document Dataset for Multi-task Information Extraction)
benchmark_details.overview: BuDDIE is the first multi-task dataset of 1,665 real-world business documents that contains rich and dense annotations for Document Classification (DC), Key Entity Extraction (KEE), and Visual Question Answering (VQA).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to facilitate research in visually rich document understanding by providing a multi-task dataset that addresses three distinct tasks: Document Classification, Key Entity Extraction, and Visual Question Answering.

data.source: Publicly available business entity documents from US state government websites.
data.annotation: Annotated by a team of annotators using specific guidelines for each task.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated according to standard practices in document classification, entity extraction, and question answering.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better model performance across tasks. For DC, macro F1 is used due to imbalanced classes; KEE uses weighted averages; VQA metrics include accuracy for boolean questions and ANLS for span questions.
methodology.baseline_results: The best baseline for each task includes BERT, RoBERTa, LayoutLM, LayoutLMv3, GPT4, and DocLLM, achieving F1 scores of 99.15 for DC, 89.97 for KEE, and 89.58 for VQA respectively.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through a two-round annotation process involving initial assignments and subsequent checks for agreement.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: BuDDIE is publicly available for non-commercial use.
